summary: This document is a Delaware state filing showing the corporate name change of Shmitka Air, Inc. to Freedom Air International, Inc. on July 6, 2010. It includes related FAA aircraft registration information for a helicopter (N722JE) owned by Shmitka Air, Inc., linking the corporate entity to a specific aircraft. This document is a series of emails and forms related to the FAA aircraft registration name change for two aircraft (Bell 407 N491GM and Sikorsky S76 N722JE) from 'Shmitka Air Inc.' to 'Freedom Air International Inc.'. It involves coordination between the aircraft company's chief pilot, its vice president, and an aircraft title service administrator to process the paperwork, including a declaration for an expedited international flight.

persons.name: Jeffrey W. Bullock
persons.context: Certifies the attached copy of the Certificate of Amendment for Shmitka Air, Inc. as a true and correct copy filed with the state.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.role: Vice President of Shmitka Air, Inc.
persons.context: Signed the Certificate of Amendment on behalf of the corporation, authorizing the name change to Freedom Air International, Inc.

persons.name: Lisa Gaskin
persons.role: Special Services Administrator at AIC Title Service, LLC
persons.context: Administrator handling the FAA aircraft registration name change process for Freedom Air International's aircraft. She corresponds with Larry Visoski and Darren Indyke to complete the paperwork.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Chief pilot who initiates the name change request for the company's aircraft. He coordinates with the title service and provides instructions, including while traveling internationally.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.role: Vice President, Freedom Air International, Inc.
persons.context: Vice President of the company who signs the declaration form and authorizes the filing of registration applications. He is the point of contact for finalizing the paperwork.

persons.name: Lauren Quick
persons.role: Employee at AIC Title Service, LLC
persons.context: Forwards the initial name change request email from Larry Visoski to Lisa Gaskin after a company acquisition.

persons.name: Howard
persons.context: Mentioned in an email from Larry Visoski asking to be notified about the company name change in reference to a contract warranty and AAG credit money with Sikorsky.

persons.name: Chris
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Howard in the same email from Larry Visoski regarding notifying Sikorsky about the company name change.

persons.name: Lesley Groff
persons.context: Named as a recipient on a FedEx mailing label along with Darren Indyke for the registration forms.

connections.description: Indyke, as Vice President of the corporation, filed a legal document (Certificate of Amendment) that was certified by Bullock in his official capacity as Secretary of State.
Visoski, the Chief Pilot, corresponds with Indyke, the Vice President, regarding the aircraft registration process and authorizes sending documents to him.
Gaskin provides aircraft title and registration services to Visoski's company, Freedom Air International.
Gaskin corresponds directly with Indyke to finalize the registration applications and obtain filing authorization.
Quick forwards work emails to Gaskin after a company merger.

events.title: Corporate Name Change Filing
events.description: Shmitka Air, Inc. filed a Certificate of Amendment with the Delaware Secretary of State to change its name to Freedom Air International, Inc.

events.title: Aircraft Certificate Issue
events.description: FAA Certificate of Registration was issued for aircraft N722JE, a Keystone Helicopter S-76C, registered to Shmitka Air Inc.

events.title: Scheduled International Flight to Bahamas
events.description: A Declaration of International Operations states aircraft N491GM is scheduled to fly from West Palm Beach, Florida, to Nassau, Bahamas, prompting a request for expedited registration.

events.title: Aero Records purchased by AIC Title Service
events.description: Lisa Gaskin mentions that Aero Records was purchased in June by AIC Title Service LLC, explaining the email routing.

events.title: Name Change Request Initiated
events.description: Larry Visoski sends an email requesting paperwork to change the FAA registration for two aircraft from Shmitka Air, Inc. to Freedom Air International.

events.title: FAA Submission Package Sent
events.description: AIC Title Service submits the name change document and two aircraft registration applications to the FAA Aircraft Registration Branch.

locations: Wilmington, DE 19809-3742 (Company address for Freedom Air International Inc.)
Oklahoma City, OK 73127 (AIC Title Service, LLC address)
Paris (mentioned as location of Larry Visoski during correspondence)
keyFacts: Shmitka Air, Inc. changed its name to Freedom Air International, Inc. on July 6, 2010.
Darren K. Indyke, as Vice President, signed the corporate filing authorizing the name change.
Aircraft N722JE, a Keystone Helicopter S-76C, was registered to Shmitka Air Inc. as of the FAA record dated August 13, 2010.
The corporate filing and aircraft registration link a specific aircraft (N722JE) to the corporate entity associated with Jeffrey Epstein's aviation operations.
The document shows the formal, legal process of rebranding one of Epstein's associated corporate entities.
Two aircraft owned by entities linked to Jeffrey Epstein are involved: Bell 407 helicopter N491GM and Sikorsky S76 helicopter N722JE.
The owning entity's name is changed from 'Shmitka Air, Inc.' to 'Freedom Air International Inc.' in July-August 2010.
A declaration form cites an international flight scheduled for August 6, 2010, from West Palm Beach to Nassau, Bahamas, for aircraft N491GM.
Darren Indyke, a known attorney for Jeffrey Epstein, is listed as Vice President of Freedom Air International Inc. and signs the declaration.
Larry Visoski, identified as Chief Pilot, is actively managing the registration change and is in communication while in Paris.
